item.title: Report X-2024050093
item.description:
Report X-2024050093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE BELT IN SORT AISLE. DETERMINED THAT IT WAS A 2 PART WITH 2 DIFFERENT CLASSIFICATIONS. FLAMMABLE LIQUID WAS DAMAGED AND IT LEAKED ON THE CORROSIVE. PACKAGE CONTAINED AND BROUGHT TO THE DMP USING THE DECISION TREE FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS. PACKAGE WAS THEN PROCESSED USING THE DECISION TREE FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS AND CORROSIVE LIQUIDS

item.title: Report I-2024050022
item.description:
Report I-2024050022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: Boston
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ? Flight 589- Upon landing I met the aircraft ? FAs stated that the passenger in 30C was now fine and that it was a quick event ? He walked off the plane unassisted and thanked the FAs ? Also of concern on this flight, passenger Calvin Lee George seated in 1A reported to the purser that his laptop was very hot and overheating ? FAs followed procedure and placed the laptop into the thermal containment bag and locked it in the aft Iav ? FAs reported this to the pilots and both MX and CS were at the plane to retrieve the bag ^ ? The laptop was not smoking or on fire, but very hot ? Laptop was returned to passenger after deplaning and MX brought a new thermal containment bag for the next departure CALVIN LEE GEORGE Email: Cgeorge1231@gmail.comEmail: Phone 307-258-4504
